meanings.definition: A toast or salutation before drinking.
meanings.sent1: At the party, everyone raised their glasses and said cheers before taking a sip.
meanings.sent2: Let's raise our glasses and say cheers to celebrate this special occasion.
meanings.sent3: The cheers echoed in the room as friends clinked their glasses together.
meanings.sent4: The cheers of the crowd filled the stadium, creating an atmosphere of excitement.
meanings.sent5: The sound of cheers signaled the start of the toast, bringing everyone together in unity.

meanings.sent1: Cheers for helping me with my homework, I really appreciate it!
meanings.sent2: As he left the room, he waved and shouted, 'Cheers, see you later!'
meanings.sent3: Cheers for the delicious meal, it was a real treat!
meanings.sent4: With a cheerful 'Cheers!', she bid farewell to her friends and headed home.
meanings.sent5: Cheers for the ride, it saved me a lot of time and effort!

meanings.sent1: His words of cheers motivated me to keep going and never give up.
meanings.sent2: Sending you cheers and positive vibes for your upcoming presentation!
meanings.sent3: The team captain's cheers inspired the players to give their best on the field.
meanings.sent4: Her cheers were like a warm hug, comforting me during tough times.
meanings.sent5: The cheers from the crowd lifted his spirits and boosted his confidence.
